caption: This was a really great experience and surprise how extensive the museum is. So many experiences, lots of fun and a journey through history. Loved it and highly recommend. I am an avid history buff and the walk through time, especially French and European history was great. All the celebs were fun too. A beautiful building and interior design too.

The Gr√©vin Museum in Paris is a must-visit for anyone interested in history, culture, and entertainment. The museum's lifelike wax figures of historical icons, celebrities, and famous personalities are truly impressive, making it feel like you're walking among legends. From French figures like Napoleon and Edith Piaf to international stars like Michael Jackson and Angelina Jolie, the attention to detail is remarkable.  The interactive elements and well-designed settings provide a unique experience, blending fun with education. Whether you're a fan of art, history, or pop culture, the Gr√©vin Museum offers something for everyone. A wonderful experience in the heart of Paris!

For me it was a bit disappointing, not better than the museum of Madame Tussauds ( museum of Madame Tussauds is way better on the details) At the beginning you waited long enough for a cheap light show, but later I discovered the building is bigger than I thought and the quantity of statues it was okay so instead of giving 1star I‚Äôd give a bit moreü§èüèª let‚Äôs be fair! But personally I think the ticket was still so much overpriced, with the student discount you will still pay ‚Ç¨24.5!!! For students that‚Äôs like a robberyü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è (same with the aquarium near Trocad√©ro, if you haven‚Äôt visit that aquarium yet, just avoid..ü§£‚òùüèª) In the souvenir shop there‚Äôs not much interesting stuff to buy as well..  If it‚Äôs not that crowded it‚Äôs actually a great place to take fun photos. And the funny part was.. there‚Äôs some actors pretending to be a statute and when you come closer they‚Äôd surprise you ü§£!!

I certainly did not expect to go to a wax museum while in Paris but there was just something intriguing about the website so my sister and I went there and we really had a pleasant time.  It was fun to see all of the exhibits and it was an easy walk from our hotel.  It would be nice to have toilets that are more accessible as we had to go to a local hotel to use the facilities but other than that this was a very pleasant surprise.

Grevin museum in Paris is a place that I thoroughly enjoyed visiting. The museum offers a unique and fun experience, allowing you to get up close to incredibly lifelike wax figures of famous celebrities, historical figures, and even fictional characters. Walking through the different exhibits felt almost surreal, as the attention to detail in each wax figure is truly remarkable.  What I loved most about it is the interactive nature of the museum. You can take photos with the figures, and it almost feels like you're meeting the actual people. The variety of displays, from movie stars to world leaders, ensures there's something interesting for everyone. The museum does an excellent job of blending entertainment with a bit of history and culture, making it both an enjoyable and educational experience.  Overall, my visit to the museum in Paris was a lot of fun, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a unique and entertaining way to spend their time in the city.

T'was an amazing experienced to this museum. For the mirror hall I'm so delighted with the show worth to recommend to friends you must visit in Paris. Staff are warm welcome to us and has a beautiful smile. I'm glad to watched the wax art of different famous people around the globe.
Cool and funny place for a visit with family or friends. A touristic place if you ask me, but it's worth a visit for a laugh!
Great experience, much better than Madame Tussaud‚Äôs. Our kids enjoyed it and it was a fantastic visit. So many statues and a 5 minute light show made an unforgettable experience.

Gr√©vin Museum was pretty cool to go and visit, but it‚Äôs not a must-do when you‚Äôre in Paris.  We completed the whole visit in around 45 minutes and saw a variety of figures, both French and international, some of which resembled the individuals they were supposed to be depicting quite closely, some of which didn‚Äôt. Either way, we got a pretty good laugh from those that didn‚Äôt, so it was still quite fun.  The experience also included a strange ¬´¬†mirror show¬†¬ª at the beginning before you go through to see the wax figures, which most people walked out of to save time.  All-in-all, our visit to Gr√©vin Museum was on the average side, but wasn‚Äôt unpleasant as we didn‚Äôt have any other activity ideas for that evening. However, at 25‚Ç¨ a head, I‚Äôm not sure I would recommend it, particularly if you‚Äôre not in Paris for a long time, as there are many better ways to spend your time.

It's much more expansive than you would think, it goes on and on. Lots of interesting people and characters, even a small section based on a great game, Detroit: Become Human! If you like wax museums and enjoy taking pictures, definitely worth checking out, especially if you have the Paris pass, then you have to go

We visited here because of the Go City Pass. The museum is absolutely amazing and interesting.  The wax people look so real, and the props are all up to standards and quality. There are different kinds of scenes with various famous people from around the world. It‚Äôs good for photo shoots with your family and friends.  Highly recommended if you‚Äôre visiting Paris and have sufficient time to walk around.
The waiting time is terrible. But that's true for every paris attraction. It can take 30min to 1 hr. But close to metro station. So commuting is easy.

The Mus√©e Gr√©vin is a fun and interactive wax museum in Paris, featuring lifelike figures of celebrities, historical figures, and even fictional characters. It's a great place for families or anyone looking for a lighthearted experience. You can pose with the figures, making it a unique photo opportunity. The museum's setup is engaging, with themed rooms and displays that make it feel like you're stepping into different eras. While it‚Äôs not as famous as other Parisian attractions, it‚Äôs an entertaining stop for those who enjoy quirky museums!

Fun, I met cool people and not so cool people. Wish it had more musical people, there were no freddie mercury or kurt cobain, which I think there should have been as they are very known and influential people. But besides that it was very good :)

Musee Grevin, situated in the heart of Paris, is a mesmerizing museum that seamlessly intertwines history, artistry, and entertainment. With its lifelike wax figures meticulously crafted to mirror their real-life counterparts, the museum offers an immersive experience that captivates visitors.  What fascinated me most about Musee Grevin was its meticulous attention to detail and its ability to transport guests into different realms. From wandering through a recreated Parisian street scene to encountering famous historical figures and modern-day celebrities, each exhibit felt like a journey into another dimension.  One of the highlights of my visit was the Hall of Mirrors, where I was enchanted by the optical illusions and playful reflections that surrounded me. Additionally, exploring the museum's themed areas, such as the World of Cinema and the Hall of Fame, provided intriguing insights into various facets of culture and entertainment.  In essence, Musee Grevin offers a captivating and enjoyable experience for all visitors, with its fusion of art, history, and interactive displays. It's a destination that invites exploration and sparks the imagination, making it a must-see attraction in Paris.

It‚Äôs a good place to visit as we had few hours free time before our flight. We booked our tickets last minute so we had to pay extra. It was ‚Ç¨53 for 2 adults. We don‚Äôt speak French and so we had trouble communicating with the person at the security but basic sign language workedüòÖ. We got there 2 PM on a Friday. It wasn‚Äôt crowded. No lines for us.  The light and sound show with the mirrors was entertaining and amazing. After the show is when you get to see all the wax figures. The wax figures you could see are some French celebrities, really famous celebrities and some historical legends. There‚Äôs also cameras inside where you can take pictures with the figures but we didn‚Äôt do it as it will cost us extra. We took our photos with some of the props that you can hold and play with. In my opinion, some of the wax figures look realistic but some don‚Äôt. Just go visit and see for yourself.  The museum is well laid out from entrance to exit. It took us 2 hours to go through it including some photo ops and some activities.  It was a well spent 2 hours plus we found a good Ramen restaurant right outside the museum and some area where you could buy some antique stuff.

The light show in beginning was good. However I was expecting little bit more. Maybe more french famous figurines. Also the lighting was poor. I think my expectations will be different if it will be my first visit of this type of museum. For the money it's not worth it.

Nicely made with friendly staff. The visual effects should be better maintained and the lighting in the museum needs an update as multiple spots are dark and can‚Äôt be seen right. I. E. Jeanne d‚ÄôArc. Besides that worth a visit. Go early in the morning to avoid long waiting lines.

Interesting museum. A Madame Tussaud‚Äôs sort of museum. There are some eye catching celebrities represented here. I think it‚Äôs worth a visit if you have the time. 4 stars because the place could be a little more well maintained. The building and interior is quite nice otherwise.

I am from India , visited this Museum yesterday (2.5.2023).  The place is worth to visit.  Photography is allowed and we can get photos with famous personalities.  Toilet facility available.    If you buy tickets 3 days in advance you will get 24%  discount  (19 euros) Otherwise you have to pay 26 euros.

Superb! The museum starts with a visual mirror light display (odd) but after that introduction are a whole lot of French celebrities. It then moves through French history and culture. The museum also includes heaps of people that are internationally renown eg. John Lennon, Steve Jobs, politicians etc. so even if you are not familiar with France you‚Äôd have a great time. The museum is presented beautifully and there are lots of interactive exhibits eg. Levitating plank, DJ studio, the voice studio, etc. We found the museum was not busy mid week (less than 30 people in the hour and a half we were there) and we could take photos comfortably with any of the exhibits. The wax people are so realistic that at times the museum attendants blend in. The museum could make the name plaques a little bigger as sometimes they were hard to read but I cannot fault them as we had so much fun. Kids under 18 yo pay a cheaper entry, tickets are discounted if purchased 3 days ahead on their website and 15% off coupons can be found in many Paris visitor brochures. Don‚Äôt miss it!

It is a nice museum to visit in Paris. This wax museum is appropriate for families and has multiple photo opportunities with popular world figures. We found a small queue with around 10 people when we visited on a Saturday evening. At the start of the museum tour, you will be greeted with a unique light & sound show. There are popular wax figures, while about a third of the wax figures are French, hence there is a good chance that you might not know most of them (if you are an international visitor). Pack light, so it will be a comfortable visit.

The wax figures are incredibly lifelike, and the attention to detail is impressive. The highlight of our visit was when we encountered what we thought was another wax figure, only for it to suddenly move‚Äîit turned out to be a real person! The surprise and laughter that followed made the experience even more memorable.

I believe no wax museum will come close to Madame Tussaud in London, and yet I really enjoyed Le Mus√©e Gr√©vin in Paris. We went at the beginning of the afternoon and there wasn‚Äôt a lot of people which was nice when taking photos. There are a lot of statues, mixing French artists and international artists. There was also quite a few interactive activities here and there. The rooms are all divided into themes which I felt were organised and nice to follow. If you like wax museum, I believe this is a good one to add to your list to visit.

If you're in paris, this place is a MUST-GO place. We were there at the opening hour, so it wasn't so crowded. But when we went out, it was a line of 3 blocks. A lot of restaurants, patisserie and stores around the Garvin, so you covered by that. Save at least 2-3 hours for this tour. And you need to be with knowledge of the local celebrities and history.

The museum houses over 200 wax statues, offering a mix of historical icons, pop culture celebrities, and political figures. Visitors can marvel at detailed sculptures of Napoleon, Louis XIV, and Marie Antoinette, alongside contemporary stars like Beyonc√©, Lionel Messi, or Brad Pitt and Indian actor Shah Rukh khan. The craftsmanship behind these figures is impressive, capturing even the minutest facial expressions and features.
Great experience,  very interactive,  worth the visit to create fun pictures and memories.
Amazing place to visit, there a is so gorgeous, and many celebrities to make photo with. I really like this experience, and kids enjoyed photos with futboll players!

My visit to the Grevin Museum today was a mixed experience that left me with both positive and negative impressions. While the museum had its moments, I found it to be less captivating than I had anticipated. The museum offers a variety of stations to explore, starting with the intriguing infinity mirror visual illusion light show. The Red Carpet section was a nice touch, and it was interesting to see a good number of actors in wax form. However, my main concern was that the overall experience lacked a certain level of engagement. I spent around 30 minutes exploring the museum, and that duration seemed sufficient to cover most of what it had to offer. While I appreciate the effort put into creating the wax figures, I couldn't help but feel that the resemblance factor fell short in many cases. Some of the figures, like Monica Bellucci, George Clooney, and Michael Jackson, were quite difficult to identify accurately. Considering the hype and expectations I had prior to my visit, I left the Grevin Museum with a sense of disappointment. It's possible that the museum has been overrated due to its reputation and location. I believe that while it's a nice attraction for a brief visit, it doesn't provide the deep and engaging experience that one might expect from a wax museum of this caliber. In conclusion, the Grevin Museum had its moments, but overall, I found it less interesting than I had hoped. The wax figures lacked consistent resemblance, and the visit felt somewhat rushed. If you're in the area and have a short time to spare, it might be worth a visit, but manage your expectations accordingly.

I was pretty disappointed by the statues, with todays technology I was expecting them to look much more identical to their model :-( They could have display a small biography of the various people (statues) on display, for education purposes. And I really think the tickets are over priced, nevertheless little sister loved the visit.

Very fun place to visit. Recommend buying tickets online to reduce wait time as even after getting tickets u have to wait in que for entry. The place is awesome n worth the visit. U get great photos with the famous personalities. N have fun in it.

Good that Macron doesn't know how crowded this place is during the pandemic - otherwise he would probably close this museum.. No distance marker on the floor and so crowded that you cannot move without touching other guests.. Very unsafe feeling during the whole time of our visit.. Avoid this place when it's raining outside! It is completely overcrowded..

Had an absolute blast at this place! Seriously, the detailing on the wax is amazing, and the eyes are so lifelike. There's also a lot more figures than I expected, and a lot of interactable parts, too!  Got some really fun pics and memories.  However, the equation on wax Einstein's coat is  E = MC2 when it should be E = Mc^2 (if not the full E = M^2c^4 + p^2c^2)  Also, it was cool seeing Einstein get so much love, even having gift shop merch of him, but we need some love for Emmy Noether, too! She may very well be the single biggest contributor to human development of the last 150 years, and nobody seems to know her. Seeing her there would've made me rate 8/5 stars.
The value you get does not justify almost a 30 euro ticket. It's fine but if you're tight with your schedule while visiting Paris you might as well skip this one.

Wax museum of Paris more than a century old. We had a complementary entry with our PARIS PASS.  The light and sound show at the beginning itself was amazing. Followed by very life like wax statues of celebrities, politicians, Sports stars etc. We spent about an hour here.  The staff were very courteous and friendly.

It was an enjoyable experience at the Grevin. Make sure to book your tickets online before you get there. The queues were absolutely long, but it moved quite fast. The wax figures were tastefully created, though a majority did lack certain features that gave them the real life look, so to speak. Also a majority of the figures were French.  But there were internationally famous figures as well. The figures are categorized into various eras and times as well as other sets. It was interesting. I recommend downloading the Grevin mobile app to help you along the way. All in all a good experience.  Try to travel light, if not you could check in your coats and bags at 2Euros an item as well. There is a metrostation right there, so travel is convenient.

Being from the US, I didn't recognize many of the celebrities and sports players that perhaps are more famous in Europe, but I really enjoyed my visit to this museum! The tour got better as it went along.. the last few rooms were some of my favorite!
Fantastic and great experience! Don't miss it! I would have liked to see Louis de Funes in it...
